entry.title: Enhancing Background Information Integration Across Recruiting, Onboarding, and Employee Central
entry.content:
Introduction

Today, I would like to share a solution that addresses a common challenge in background information integration (e.g., outside work experience, education, languages, certificates, and more) across SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting, Onboarding, and Employee Central (EC).

By introducing both the SAP standard design and an enhanced solution I implemented, I aim to highlight:

  • The limitations of the current standard design
  • Why SAP should consider improving this area
  • How organizations can achieve a low-cost enhancement for a more seamless process

Background

A customer required a seamless experience for collecting candidate background information. Ideally, the process should follow these steps:

  1. Application Stage: Candidates provide background information (outside work experience, education, language proficiency, and certificates) when submitting a job application.
  2. Onboarding Stage: Once an offer is accepted, candidates can review and update their data in Onboarding and add additional background information which is not required to fill in recruiting phase (e.g., memberships).
  3. Employee Central Integration: This background data should flow automatically and consistently into SuccessFactors Employee Central (EC).
  4. Employee Self-Service (ESS): Background information should remain editable via EC workflows after hiring.

Unfortunately, this seemingly simple and logical process is not fully supported in the standard SuccessFactors design due to the following limitations:

  1. Background elements in the candidate profile can only be synchronized directly to the Employee Profile without through onboarding phase. Please refer to KBA: 2233525 - How is the system working with sm-mapping? - Recruiting Management.
  2. Standard background elements cannot be configured in the New Hire Data Collection template. This means background data cannot be reviewed or updated during the Onboarding phase.
  3. EC workflows cannot be configured for standard background elements. Typically, MDF-based background information is required in order to enable workflows.  Please refer to KBA: 2829360 - Workflows and Business Rules - Are they Supported for EP Portlets?

Workaround

To enable ESS workflows and Onboarding Data Collection, it is recommended to use MDF-based background information.   The MDF-based background objects should be configured to mirror the field settings of the standard background elements. This ensures consistency of data structures across modules.   To maintain alignment between the two, use Integration Center to perform a one-way synchronization from MDF-based background information to the standard background elements.

However, this introduces a new challenge:
How can we keep the standard background information blocks (required by Talent Development modules) aligned with the MDF-based data? The key difficulties are:

  1. Automatic synchronization of MDF data into background information blocks.
  2. Avoiding duplicate entries: Each background record is uniquely identified by backgroundElementId, which is auto-generated by the system. If not matched, the system treats incoming records as new ones. Since Integration Center jobs cannot capture responses (as in CSV imports), careful design is required to prevent duplicate records.

Solution

The solution involves using Integration Center to auto-sync MDF-based background information into Employee Profile (EP) background elements for new hires. This is a one-time sync executed after the employee becomes an EC user.

 

Key Design Points

  • Timing of Integration

    • Synchronization should occur only after Manage Pending Hire is completed and the Employee Conversion job has run. At this point, the Employee Profile is active and actionable.
    • Integration criteria should be based on the OnboardingHireStatus in the Process Table, combined with a recent hire date filter (e.g., within the past week). This ensures only newly hired employees are included.

 

  • Handling Multiple Records (e.g., Education)

    • When working with multiple education records, the challenge is that Integration Center cannot navigate from a child entity back to the parent object.
    • To address this, a custom user field is created to automatically populate the new hire’s User ID using an onsave Business Rule.
    • With this field in place, the integration can navigate from the child entity (e.g., Education) to the User/ONB2Process table, applying the required filters.

  • Removed Duplicated Background Info via Provisioning Job

    • Enable Provisioning Job to remove the duplicated background info record which is inserted by API or Integration Center accidentally and unexpected. Please refer to KBA: 2790234 - Delete Duplicate Background Data

Conclusion

While the standard SAP SuccessFactors design does not currently provide a seamless end-to-end flow for background information, this MDF-based enhancement with Integration Center offers a practical, low-cost workaround.
It enables:

  • A smoother transition of data across Recruiting, Onboarding, and Employee Central
  • The ability for employees to manage and update their background information through ESS workflows
  • Continued support for Talent Development modules by keeping standard background blocks aligned This solution demonstrates how thoughtful enhancements can bridge gaps in the current design and deliver the seamless user experience customers expect.

entry.title: Re: ps project closing
entry.content:
Hi Raheel2

You need to rearrange these secondary cost elements in the allocation structure defined in the WBS settlement profile. In addition, you must add an entry in "Settlement Cost Elements" so that the asset is settled using a specific "settlement cost element" instead of "by cost element."

In the configuration settings, go to "Create Allocation Structure" and locate your allocation structure. Under "Assignments," add a new line for the secondary cost elements and include them in the "Source" folder. Then, create a new entry under "Settlement Cost Elements," folder setting the receiver category to "Asset" and assigning a cost element in the "Settlement Cost Element" field. Make sure not to select "by cost element." Create another line, setting the receiver category to "WBS element" and select "by cost element".

In addition, remove these secondary cost elements from any Assigments.

With this setup, whenever a cost element included in this assignment is settled to an asset, the system will use the defined settlement cost element.

entry.title: Re: SAP BTP ABAP Environment – Manage System Hibernation
entry.content:
@wagener-mark "Does the use of the free-tier ABAP environment entitle us to use the Landscape Portal in any subaccount (either the same subaccount as the free-tier ABAP  or any other subaccount) environment with the standard plan, without incurring any costs?"
=> Yes, any subaccount without additional costs. BTW: The usage of the Landscape Portal is mandatory for the free tier offering, because you need to restart the system each day after the automatic hibernation each night. Restarting a system is only supported via Landscape Portal. (To be more precise with "any subaccount" means: Any of the ~25 regions where SAP BTP ABAP Environment is supported today at all)

"The help is a bit misleading ...": You are right. The documentation will be adjusted soon.

entry.title: SAP B1: Formatted Search auto-trigger on header UDF does not fire (manual run works)
entry.content:
Environment:
  • SAP Business One [version 10.0/ 10.00.201]: on SQL Server
  • Client: 64-bit [FP 2208]
  • Document: Goods Receipt PO (OPDN)
  • All fields used below are header-level UDFs
Goal

Populate UDF U_mbl (MBL number) automatically from UDF U_billOfLanding when the user changes U_billOfLanding.
Additionally, only accept the value if the first 4 characters match a carrier code stored in UDT [@CTX_CARRIER].

UDFs
  • U_billOfLanding (NVARCHAR(50), header)
  • U_mbl (NVARCHAR(50), header)
Saved Query (works when executed manually)
-- CopyMBLausBL (SQL Server)
DECLARE @v NVARCHAR(50) =
  REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE($[$U_billOfLanding.0.0], CHAR(9), ''), CHAR(10), ''), CHAR(13), ''), ' ', '');

SELECT CASE 
         WHEN EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM [@CTX_CARRIER] T0 WHERE T0.Code = LEFT(@v, 4))
         THEN @v
         ELSE ''
       END;

(The query returns exactly one scalar value. Example input “MEDUK 4923174” → sanitized to “MEDUK4923174”.)

FMS Setup on U_mbl
  • Search in User-Defined Values by Saved Query → CopyMBLausBL
  • Auto Refresh When Field Changes → Trigger Bill of Lading (U_billOfLanding, header UDF)
  • Also tried: different trigger field (another header UDF), and Regularly Update
Expected vs. Actual
  • Expected: After editing U_billOfLanding and leaving the field, U_mbl should be filled by the query result.
  • Actual: Nothing happens.
    If I click the magnifier on U_mbl, the query executes and the field is populated correctly. “Regularly update” also makes no difference.
Reproduction Steps
  1. Open a GRPO (OPDN) in Add/Update mode.
  2. Enter a value in U_billOfLanding (e.g., MEDUK 4923174) and tab out.
  3. Observe U_mbl: no change.
  4. Click the magnifier (Formatted Search) on U_mbl: field is filled as expected.
Troubleshooting Done
  • Recreated the FMS mapping from scratch.
  • Verified the trigger points to the header UDF (System Information shows U_billOfLanding).
  • Tried an extremely simple query on U_mbl:
SELECT $[$U_billOfLanding.0.0]  -- mirror test

and even:

SELECT 'PING'

 

→ Auto-trigger still does not write.

  • Tried an alternative trigger field (another header UDF) → same behavior.
  • Set Regularly Update (for testing) → still no update.
  • UDF lengths are sufficient (50 chars), data types NVARCHAR; query returns exactly one value.
Questions for the community
  1. Are there known issues with header-level FMS auto-refresh on OPDN in [my version/FP]?
  2. Does the target UDF need to be on the standard UDF side panel for the FMS trigger to fire (vs. embedded on the main form via Screen Painter/Add-on)?
  3. Could an Add-on (e.g., Coresuite or others) intercept UI/Validate events and prevent FMS auto-execution, even though manual execution still works?
  4. Any additional settings/logging I can enable to diagnose why Auto Refresh When Field Changes isn’t firing?
  5. Is there a recommended workaround (besides scripting) to make header-UDF→header-UDF FMS triggers reliable?
Notes
  • Manually running the saved query always returns the correct value.
  • The issue appears to be the auto-trigger, not the SQL.
Attachments
  • Screenshot of FMS setup dialog showing the saved query and trigger field (attached).

entry.title: Re: Is there any video/interactive material to demonstate...
entry.content:
@rekafulop 

Guide for Manual Reconciliation in "Reconcile Cash Flow" App

Prerequisites:

Electronic Bank Statement has been posted via the Manage Bank Statements app (F0786). This populates the system with the bank's records.

Cash Flow Transactions exist (e.g., from posted payments, invoices, etc.). This is your internal company's record of cash movements.

Steps in the Reconcile Cash Flow App (F5286):

Open the App: Launch the Reconcile Cash Flow app from your Fiori launchpad.

Select Parameters: You will typically filter by:

Company Code

Bank Account

Key Date (the statement date you are reconciling)

Click Go.

Understand the Split-Screen View: The app's power is in this view.

Top Section (Bank Statement Lines): Displays all transactions from the imported electronic bank statement for the selected account and date.

Bottom Section (Cash Flow Items): Displays all open (uncleared) cash flow items from your internal system for the same bank account.

Perform the Reconciliation (The Interactive Part):

You will visually compare the amounts and details between the two lists.

To clear an item manually:

Select one or more lines in the Bank Statement section.

Select one or more corresponding lines in the Cash Flow Items section.

Click the Clear button. The system will create a link between the two, marking them as reconciled. The amounts will typically grey out or disappear from the "open items" list.

Handling Differences:

Bank Charges/Interest: These appear on the bank statement but not in your cash flow. You will need to post them. The app often allows you to select such a line and choose Post -> Post Bank Fee or Post Interest directly. This creates an accounting document and clears the line.

Outstanding Checks/Deposits: Items that appear in your cash flow but not on the bank statement (e.g., checks not yet cashed) will remain open. They should be reconciled in the next period.

Post and Close: Once you have matched all possible items and posted necessary adjustments (fees, interest), the difference between the statement balance and your internal book balance should be zero (or explainable by legitimate outstanding items). You can then finalize the reconciliation.

entry.title: Re: Manage single Application in SAP Cloud Identity Service
entry.content: It is not mandatory to use IAS as a proxy. Alternatively, it can be used with local IAS users for specific applications or based on certain rules. For example, if you have an app in IAS, you can configure "Identity Authentication" under "Conditional Authentication" → Identity Authentication. In the latest Workzone scenarios, a new application is created for each Workzone instance. The challenge arises when you want to share the same instance with both internal and external users—you need to implement conditional authentication rules or use specific links, which makes the solution more complex. If you have a dedicated Workzone instance for your app, the setup is much simpler.

entry.title: Re: SQL Anywhere 17 MESSAGE TO LOG statement does not log...
entry.content:
Re: After executing MESSAGE '...' TO LOG statement the msg_database column is null in SELECT * FROM sa_server_messages(null, -10)

MESSAGE statement

  • CONSOLE

    Send messages to the database server message window and the database server message log file if one has been specified. CONSOLE is the default.

sa_server_messages System Procedure

Allows you to return messages from the database server messages window as a result set.

The key phrase here is "server messages window". TO LOG does not write to the "server messages window".

Re: if there are multiple databases on same server I do not know from where the message came.

MESSAGE now(), ' ', db_name(), ' ', user_name(), ' ', connection_property('number') to console; // and much more could be included

Re:  when too many messages are sent there.

An option can be set using sa_server_option to limit the size of the console log file (ConsoleLogMaxSize). Then you could write and read the console log file using SQL statements like the following.

message 'DEBUG ', db_name(), ' ', user_name(), ' ', connection_property('number'), ' some info' to log;
select * from sa_split_list( cast(xp_read_file('demo.txt') as long varchar), '\n' ) WHERE row_value LIKE '%. DEBUG %';

There are likely many other creative ways to do logging.

entry.title: S4HANA private - split FU creation for delivery note based on dynamic criteria using BADI
entry.content:
Hello,

for a dynamic split of a delivery note into more than one freight unit, not based on static criteria like "split every 20 tons" but considering the planning result of the external TMS optimization, I found BADI "/SCMTMS/FUB_CORE" which might solve this requirement, however, I didn't find any kind of documentation or sample coding on how to use it.

The goal would be like:

  • Delivery note with item having 60 tons
    • Create freight unit #1 with 25 tons, create freight order #1 for this FU
    • Create freight unit #2 with 20 tons, create freight order #2 for this FU
    • Create freight unit #3 with 15 tons, create freight order #3 for this FU

For the next delivery note having 60tons, the requirement for splitting could be 20-21-19 tons, that's the reason why splitting via FUBR doesn't work.

It's possible to manually split a FU using the Fiori app, however, the split mentioned above based on dynamic criteria should happen when creating/saving the delivery note already.

I've checked the TM extension guide as well, however, didn't find a hint.

Any ideas?

Thanks & regards

Wolfgang

entry.title: Re: S4HANA private - split FU creation for delivery note...
entry.content:
" Class implementation for BADI /SCMTMS/FUB_CORE
CLASS zcl_tms_dynamic_fu_split DEFINITION PUBLIC FINAL CREATE PUBLIC.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    INTERFACES /scmtms/if_fub_core.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    METHODS:
      " Main method to handle dynamic splitting
      split_fu_based_on_optimization
        IMPORTING
          it_fu_root     TYPE /scmtms/t_tor_root_k
          it_fu_item     TYPE /scmtms/t_tor_item_tr_k
        CHANGING
          ct_fu_root     TYPE /scmtms/t_tor_root_k
          ct_fu_item     TYPE /scmtms/t_tor_item_tr_k
          ct_fu_stop     TYPE /scmtms/t_tor_stop_k
          ct_fu_stop_seq TYPE /scmtms/t_tor_stop_seq_k,
      
      " Get optimization data from external TMS
      get_optimization_data
        IMPORTING
          iv_delivery_number TYPE vbeln
        RETURNING
          VALUE(rt_opt_data) TYPE ztt_tms_optimization_data,
      
      " Create FU items with split quantities
      create_split_fu_items
        IMPORTING
          is_original_item   TYPE /scmtms/s_tor_item_tr_k
          it_optimization    TYPE ztt_tms_optimization_data
        CHANGING
          ct_fu_root         TYPE /scmtms/t_tor_root_k
          ct_fu_item         TYPE /scmtms/t_tor_item_tr_k
          ct_fu_stop         TYPE /scmtms/t_tor_stop_k
          ct_fu_stop_seq     TYPE /scmtms/t_tor_stop_seq_k.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_tms_dynamic_fu_split IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD /scmtms/if_fub_core~prepare_fub.
    " Only process if we have FU items to potentially split
    IF it_fu_item IS NOT INITIAL.
      split_fu_based_on_optimization(
        EXPORTING
          it_fu_root     = it_fu_root
          it_fu_item     = it_fu_item
        CHANGING
          ct_fu_root     = ct_fu_root
          ct_fu_item     = ct_fu_item
          ct_fu_stop     = ct_fu_stop
          ct_fu_stop_seq = ct_fu_stop_seq
      ).
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD split_fu_based_on_optimization.
    DATA:
      lt_optimization_data TYPE ztt_tms_optimization_data,
      lv_delivery_number   TYPE vbeln.
    
    " Group items by delivery note
    DATA(lt_items_by_delivery) = VALUE /scmtms/t_tor_item_tr_k( 
      FOR GROUPS <group> OF <item> IN it_fu_item
      GROUP BY <item>-base_btd_tco WITHOUT MEMBERS ( <item> ) ).
    
    LOOP AT lt_items_by_delivery ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_item_group>).
      " Extract delivery number from reference
      lv_delivery_number = <ls_item_group>-base_btd_id.
      
      " Get optimization data from external TMS
      lt_optimization_data = get_optimization_data( lv_delivery_number ).
      
      " Only proceed if we have optimization data
      IF lt_optimization_data IS NOT INITIAL.
        " Process each item in this delivery
        LOOP AT it_fu_item ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_original_item>)
          WHERE base_btd_id = lv_delivery_number.
          
          " Create split FU items based on optimization data
          create_split_fu_items(
            EXPORTING
              is_original_item = <ls_original_item>
              it_optimization  = lt_optimization_data
            CHANGING
              ct_fu_root       = ct_fu_root
              ct_fu_item       = ct_fu_item
              ct_fu_stop       = ct_fu_stop
              ct_fu_stop_seq   = ct_fu_stop_seq
          ).
        ENDLOOP.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD get_optimization_data.
    " This method would interface with your external TMS
    " For demonstration, we'll use a mock implementation
    
    " In a real scenario, you would call the TMS API or read from a custom table
    " that stores the optimization results by delivery number
    
    " Mock data for testing - replace with actual TMS integration
    CASE iv_delivery_number.
      WHEN '80000001'. " First delivery note with 60 tons
        rt_opt_data = VALUE #(
          ( sequence = 1 optimal_quantity = 25 unit = 'TON' )
          ( sequence = 2 optimal_quantity = 20 unit = 'TON' )
          ( sequence = 3 optimal_quantity = 15 unit = 'TON' )
        ).
      WHEN '80000002'. " Second delivery note with 60 tons
        rt_opt_data = VALUE #(
          ( sequence = 1 optimal_quantity = 20 unit = 'TON' )
          ( sequence = 2 optimal_quantity = 21 unit = 'TON' )
          ( sequence = 3 optimal_quantity = 19 unit = 'TON' )
        ).
      WHEN OTHERS.
        " For other deliveries, return empty to use standard behavior
    ENDCASE.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD create_split_fu_items.
    DATA:
      lv_fu_count        TYPE i,
      lv_total_processed TYPE /scmtms/tor_quantity,
      lv_remaining_qty   TYPE /scmtms/tor_quantity.
    
    " Calculate initial values
    lv_fu_count = lines( ct_fu_root ).
    lv_remaining_qty = is_original_item-quantity.
    
    " Create a new FU for each optimization entry
    LOOP AT it_optimization ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_optimization>).
      " Check if we've already allocated the full quantity
      IF lv_remaining_qty <= 0.
        EXIT.
      ENDIF.
      
      " Determine quantity for this FU (don't exceed remaining)
      DATA(lv_fu_quantity) = nmin( val1 = <ls_optimization>-optimal_quantity
                                   val2 = lv_remaining_qty ).
      
      " Adjust remaining quantity
      lv_remaining_qty = lv_remaining_qty - lv_fu_quantity.
      lv_fu_count = lv_fu_count + 1.
      
      " Create new FU root entry
      DATA(ls_new_fu_root) = VALUE /scmtms/s_tor_root_k(
        " Copy most attributes from original FU
        node_id     = /scmtms/cl_tor_services=>get_new_node_id( )
        tor_id      = |{ is_original_item-base_btd_id }-{ lv_fu_count }|
        tproc       = ct_fu_root[ 1 ]-tproc
        tor_cat     = /scmtms/if_tor_const=>sc_tor_category-freight_unit
        " ... copy other relevant attributes
      ).
      APPEND ls_new_fu_root TO ct_fu_root.
      
      " Create new FU item
      DATA(ls_new_fu_item) = is_original_item.
      ls_new_fu_item-node_id       = /scmtms/cl_tor_services=>get_new_node_id( ).
      ls_new_fu_item-parent_node_id = ls_new_fu_root-node_id.
      ls_new_fu_item-quantity      = lv_fu_quantity.
      ls_new_fu_item-base_quantity = lv_fu_quantity.
      " ... set other item attributes as needed
      APPEND ls_new_fu_item TO ct_fu_item.
      
      " Copy stop sequences (simplified - in reality would need more logic)
      LOOP AT ct_fu_stop_seq ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_stop_seq>)
        WHERE parent_node_id = is_original_item-parent_node_id.
        DATA(ls_new_stop_seq) = <ls_stop_seq>.
        ls_new_stop_seq-node_id = /scmtms/cl_tor_services=>get_new_node_id( ).
        ls_new_stop_seq-parent_node_id = ls_new_fu_root-node_id.
        APPEND ls_new_stop_seq TO ct_fu_stop_seq.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDLOOP.
    
    " Remove the original FU if we created splits
    IF lines( it_optimization ) > 0 AND lv_remaining_qty = 0.
      " Remove original FU root
      DELETE ct_fu_root WHERE node_id = is_original_item-parent_node_id.
      
      " Remove original FU items
      DELETE ct_fu_item WHERE parent_node_id = is_original_item-parent_node_id.
      
      " Remove original stop sequences
      DELETE ct_fu_stop_seq WHERE parent_node_id = is_original_item-parent_node_id.
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

entry.title: Re: Using Default Route transit time in the Freight Unit scheduling
entry.content:
@asahoo271

This feature does not calculate requested pickup and delivery dates directly. The dates are calculated from the requirements document and can be adjusted before going through the Default Route calculation using the PU/DL condition in the FU type configuration.

Based on these dates, and based on the times registered in the default route, TM calculates the stage dates according to the direction configured in "Scheduling Settings." For example, I can calculate the stage dates based on the requested pickup date or the requested delivery date.

entry.title: How to use Data Variants from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Test Automation Tool (TAT) in SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
Context

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition solution comes with built-in test automation capabilities. Delivered with pre-scripted test processes and post-upgrade test coverage, the embedded Test Automation Tool (TAT) helps accelerate validation cycles and supports the creation of a robust regression test suite.

One particularly powerful, yet sometimes misunderstood, feature of the TAT is the Test Data Container (TDC).

This component allows project teams to define data variants, making it easier to test the same process across different business scenarios. In this blog, we will explore how to define and manage these variants, how automated test cases are synchronized with SAP Cloud ALM, and how the mapping between TAT and Cloud ALM test assets works, along with practical insights into what to expect.

 

Part 1: Understanding Test Data Containers (TDCs) and Data Variants in TAT

The Test Data Container (TDC) serves as a central repository for reusable test data, organized by functional area. It enables teams to manage a single source of test data for end-to-end test flows, which can be reused across multiple processes.

Data variants within the TDC can be defined manually or imported using Excel templates. Each variant represents a specific configuration of data inputs, for example, different company codes, plants, or customer IDs used to drive a specific execution of a test process.

 

Key Concepts

  • A Test Process represents a predefined business process, composed of one or more process steps.
  • A Test Plan in the TAT represents an end-to-end business flow, and may include several test processes.
  • Information can be passed from one process to another within a TAT Test Plan, supporting chaining and data reuse.
  • All test data required for the execution of a Test Plan can be maintained using TDCs and data variants.

Want to learn more? Two of my colleagues have written excellent deep-dives on this topic:
Test Data Container – Use Case
Test Data Container – Features Overview

Part 2: Synchronizing Automated Test Cases into SAP Cloud ALM

Once a Test Plan is created in TAT and assigned with its corresponding data variants, the next step is to synchronize it into SAP Cloud ALM using the Test Preparation app.

Here’s how to proceed:

  1. Click the Import button at the top right of the screen.
  2. Search for the Test Plans you created in TAT that you want to import.
  3. Select the desired Test Plans and click Import.
  4. Choose the appropriate Project Scope and Solution Process (if relevant)
  5. Click Save.

Important Notes:

  • If a Test Plan in TAT contains multiple data variants, each variant will be synchronized as a separate automated test case in SAP Cloud ALM.
    → For example, one Test Plan with 3 variants in TAT = 3 individual test cases in Cloud ALM.
  • In SAP Cloud ALM, the Test Case title is not the name of the Test Process from TAT, but rather the Test Plan name from TAT.
    The Variant field in SAP Cloud ALM is the key differentiator between the test cases derived from the same plan.

 

Part 3: Managing Test Plans in SAP Cloud ALM

Once test cases have been synchronized, you can group them into Test Plans within SAP Cloud ALM for structured execution and tracking.

Key Capabilities in CALM:

  • Combine manual and automated test cases in a single Test Plan
  • Assign test cases to individual testers
  • Track execution progress and report results centrally

For a detailed explanation of how to manage Test Plans in SAP Cloud ALM, I highly recommend this blog by my colleague Reiner: Advanced Test Orchestration and Tester Assignment

Clarification on Terminology

It’s important to note that the term "Test Plan" is used in both TAT and SAP Cloud ALM, but the meaning differs:

  • In TAT, a Test Plan defines how a business process is executed across multiple data variants.
  • In SAP Cloud ALM, a Test Plan is an organizational container for execution and reporting purposes.

There is no direct link between the Test Plans in both systems, they are conceptually and technically separate.

Conclusion

The integration between the S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool and SAP Cloud ALM offers a streamlined approach to managing test processes and data variants across the application lifecycle. By understanding the roles of Test Data Containers, how synchronization works, and the difference in test plan concepts between the two platforms, teams can better prepare for scalable and maintainable test automation.

Let me know in the comments if you’ve worked with data variants in TAT and how your team uses them within SAP Cloud ALM!

entry.title: 🚀 SAP BTP Weekly: Practical AI, Enhanced Analytics, and a Vision for the Future
entry.content:
1. Joule Studio and No-Code AI Agents
Creating intelligent agents without coding is now possible in SAP Build. This opens the door for both business and IT teams to build copilots that answer questions and automate tasks quickly.

Beyond the no-code hype, the challenge is cultural: will users trust an internally developed agent? Imagine a procurement team building an agent to negotiate with suppliers—it speeds up the process, but what if the agent misinterprets company policies? Human oversight remains essential.

🔗 https://www.sap.com/spain/products/artificial-intelligence/joule-studio.html 

2. Joule for Consultants
A new program helps SAP consultants use Joule as a copilot during implementations. It includes guides, templates, and real-world use cases that can be applied directly to client projects.

The potential lies in reducing configuration time and accelerating deployments. But it also raises questions: to what extent will Joule replace manual tasks? For example, in a SuccessFactors project, it could generate initial configurations within minutes—though expert validation will always be required.

🔗 https://www.sap.com/spain/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant/sap-consulting-capability.html 

3. Integration with Event Mesh and Kafka
SAP Advanced Event Mesh now connects with Apache Kafka, enabling hybrid and decentralized architectures. This allows for more resilient micro-integrations compared to traditional point-to-point models.

The practical challenge lies in governance. A retail company might use it to synchronize inventories across multiple channels in seconds, but managing topics and ensuring traceability can become complex. SAP provides connectors, but the learning curve is real.

🔗 https://events.sap.com/eur-expertsession-aemkafka/en_us/home.html 

4. Real-World FinOps on BTP
Companies adopting FinOps on BTP are gaining visibility and achieving up to 20% reductions in cloud costs. Dashboards and alerts help CIOs and CFOs make faster decisions.

The challenge is organizational: finance and IT often “speak different languages.” Imagine a telco optimizing Integration Suite consumption—without internal agreements, discussions about who pays what can escalate. The technology is ready, governance isn’t always.

🔗 https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/enhanced-finops-capabilities-for-sap-btp/ba-p/14113797 

5. SAP Build Process Automation
New preconfigured processes allow automation of HR, compliance, and finance tasks in days. A “shortcut” for organizations seeking efficiency without large-scale projects.

The tricky part is resistance to change. An HR team may see value in automating vacation approvals, but users often fear losing control. SAP provides ready-to-use processes, but tailoring them to each organization still requires effort.

🔗 https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/public-site-for-sap-build-pre-built-content/ba-p/13562272 

6. BDC and Databricks: Next-Generation Analytics
The integration between SAP BTP Data & Analytics (BDC) and Databricks enables unification of SAP and non-SAP data in lakehouse environments for AI and advanced analytics.

Picture a mining company combining SAP financial data with IoT sensor data in Databricks: the predictive potential is enormous. The challenge lies in governance: without a clear model, “data democratization” can turn into chaos. SAP ensures traceability, but governance is each organization’s responsibility.

🔗 https://news.sap.com/2025/02/sap-databricks-open-bold-new-era-data-ai/ 

7. SAP Now Argentina – Business Highlights
The event showcased how local companies are applying SAP BTP and Joule to real business processes. Applied AI was the highlight, with use cases in retail, energy, and manufacturing.

Beyond the excitement, scalability remains a question. Can a successful pilot in one area be extended across the entire organization? Use cases inspire, but customers still need clarity on timelines and adoption costs.

🔗 https://www.sap.com/products/data-cloud/databricks.html 

8. SAP Customer Success Day – Our Experience
This week we had the privilege of meeting with over 20 customers in an exclusive workshop on enterprise integration, exploring the power of SAP BTP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) and SAP Integration Suite.

Beyond the technology, what stood out was how different customers face similar challenges: shifting from point-to-point to event-driven models without losing control or simplicity. A bank raised the need to process thousands of transactions in real time; a retail company sought to orchestrate omnichannel inventory. Everyone agreed the key is not just the tool, but the ability to redesign processes.

🔗 https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7369726725749903369/ 

At the end of the day, BTP is experienced differently depending on the role: for a CIO it’s efficiency and control, for an architect it’s integration, for a Basis administrator it’s security, and for a consultant it’s delivery speed. Yet ultimately, we all face the same question: how do we create real business value from technology without getting lost in complexity?

entry.title: Re: How to Use NPM Modules Like crypto-js in SAPUI5 Using UI5 Tooling Modules
entry.content:
Yes, this setup does work after deployment to Cloud Foundry, not just locally. The key is to separate runtime dependencies and build-time dependencies correctly:

Install libraries like crypto-js as runtime dependencies:

npm install crypto-js --save

Install ui5-tooling-modules only as a dev dependency (build-time only):

npm install ui5-tooling-modules --save-dev

When you build (ui5 build or mbt build for MTA) and deploy (cf push), the UI5 Tooling bundles the npm module (crypto-js) into your project. After deployment, you can still use it inside your controller:

sap.ui.define([
  "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller",
  "crypto-js/sha256"
], function (Controller, SHA256) {
  "use strict";
  return Controller.extend("your.project.namespace.controller.Main", {
    onInit: function () {
      var msg = "Hello from Deployed App!";
      var hash = SHA256(msg).toString();
      console.log("SHA256 Hash (CF):", hash);
    }
  });
});

entry.title: SAP Connect 2025: The Ultimate Business Transformation Experience
entry.content:
Hello, SAP Community!

I'm thrilled to introduce you to something completely new in the SAP events landscape: SAP Connect 2025, our groundbreaking annual event for business leaders that highlights how businesses maximize their SAP investments and accelerate transformation.

You've invested significantly in SAP solutions across your organization. Your CHRO relies on SAP SuccessFactors for talent management, your CPO uses SAP Ariba to optimize procurement, your CMO leverages SAP Customer Experience solutions to drive engagement, your CFO depends on SAP S/4 Finance to keep the business running, and your COO manages supply chain demand with SAP Integrated Business Planning. But here's the challenge every C-suite leader faces—how do you connect your organization’s disconnected landscape so you can move beyond implementation to true business transformation?

 

 

Beyond Software: Your Partner in Business Success

While SAP is fundamentally a software company, our mission extends far beyond delivering technology. We empower business leaders, whether you're a CHRO building world-class teams, a CPO driving procurement excellence, a CMO creating customer loyalty, a CFO optimizing financial performance, or a COO ensuring operational excellence, to achieve transformational business outcomes.

The reality is that technology alone cannot be the sole factor in innovation. It's the strategic implementation and utilization of that technology that is aligned with your specific business challenges and opportunities that creates measurable value. SAP Connect 2025 is designed around this fundamental truth:

Your business outcomes are our primary measure of achievement.

 

 

The Reality Check: Where Most Organizations Stand Today

The 2025 C-Suite survey by Thomson Reuters Institute identified the following as the key challenges that currently hinder the effectiveness of enabling functions within organizations:

  1. Ineffective data and information flows between different departments
  2. Time-consuming compliance and reporting tasks
  3. Staffing and resourcing challenges, and
  4. Poor data quality and structure.

 

Do any of them sound familiar? Regardless of your role and vertical, these challenges continue to be roadblocks to achieving short- and long-term success for today’s businesses.

 

 

What Makes SAP Connect Different: Connect Everything, Achieve Anything

If you’re a seasoned business leader with SAP events, you’ll notice that it’s looking a little different this year. Unlike the previous years of offering separate events for each department, SAP Connect is now one unified event with five specialized experiences, each designed for a specific department. This clearly illustrates the connection between SAP Business Suite and how these solutions work together to drive enterprise-wide value.

  • Success Connect: Transform your workforce with the latest HR solutions | Register
  • Spend Connect: Optimize business and realize opportunities  | Register
  • Customer Experience Connect: Drive customer loyalty and build relationships  | Register
  • Finance Connect: Revolutionize financial operations to beat market volatility  | Register
  • Supply Chain Connect: Build resilient, intelligent supply chain networks | Register

Each Connect event delivers deep, dedicated content while maintaining a connection to the broader SAP Business Suite ecosystem. You'll walk away with concrete strategies tailored to your specific business challenges.

 

 

How does the SAP Business Technology Platform fit in SAP Connect?

It couldn’t be more fitting! Like this year’s theme of ‘Connect everything. Achieve anything’, SAP Integration Suite within SAP Business Technology Platform is the answer to cross-organization connectivity. Integrating your across SAP and third-party applications allows you to build, extend and automate with SAP Build￼more to bring value to the business. Also, with prebuilt integration packages and AI-assisted features, the ROI can be achieved more efficiently. Take these verified SAP BTP use cases as an example:

  1. Create a custom mobile app for HR using SAP Build: 

    1. Business challenge: Complex processes and access to business applications for field-based and deskless employees. Error-prone processes with little visibility into data and insights
    2. Business values: Reduced implementation time with low-code development tools. Improved employee efficiency by streamlining and automating processes
    3. Customer example: CITIC Pacific Mining Management Pty Ltd. integrated SAP SuccessFactors applications, then used SAP Build to automate document digitization in a safe and compliant way via their mobile web app. This eliminated manual information collection, entry, and validation, keeping the data always up-to-date and compliant. This allowed CITIC to save up to $A300,000 annually on worker productivity.

  2. Expedite your financial close with intelligent automation:

    1. Business challenge: Reliance on error-prone e-mail and spreadsheet tasks for financial closing, paired with time-consuming repetitive tasks.
    2. Business values: Automated tasks with SAP-curated agents and document task completion that decreases errors and strengthens data validation and verification.
    3. Customer example: De Agostini Publishing achieved significant automation improvements in its vendor invoice processing. Over 91% of PO-referred invoices are now processed automatically, and approximately 500 hours are saved per month through its SAP-based solution. The company successfully processes 54,000 paper-based vendor invoices annually while achieving 90-95% text capture accuracy from PDF invoices.

If you're interested, check out the full list of our verified SAP BTP use cases here.

 

 

What's Coming Next in This Series

But don’t let that stop you from registering and checking out the event agenda to see all the sessions offered at Connect here!

entry.title: Re: Unable to Clear Special G/L Transactions with CME Ind...
entry.content:
Hello @BlasRosello4 

My apologies for the late reply,

Understood. If you need outbound checks with the Special G/L indicator “S” and no down payments:

In S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, Special G/L indicators are provided in advance. They cannot be created or modified; if “S” is not in your list, you won't be able to add it. SAP Support Portal/2761212 - Create or Change Special G/L Indicator in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

For manual outbound checks, utilise Post Outgoing Payments (F1612); the app supports using Special G/L for postings, but the traditional A is down payment isn’t available in these Fiori apps. For cases other than down payments, select an Other-type Special G/L where available.

SAP Help Portal-Post Outgoing Payments

SAP Support Portal-3113965 - Error "Special G/L transactions of type A are not supported" in Fiori Apps - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Handle the check lifecycle, such as creating, converting, voiding, reprinting, and resetting checks, to Manage Outgoing Checks (F1578). SAP Help Portal-Manage Outgoing Checks  SAP Support Portal-3037953 - Manage Outgoing Checks (App ID F1578)

If you need postings to go to the correct subaccount, maintain the mapping via SSCUI 100297 – Automatic Account Determination (Alternative Reconciliation Accounts for Special G/L). SAP Support Portal-2761212 - Create or Change Special G/L Indicator in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition    SAP Help Portal-Alternate Reconciliation Account

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP Composable Storefront - Closing a Dialog service...
entry.content:
Hello,

I suggest trying to use openDialogAndSubscribe instead of openDialog as mentioned here:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_COMMERCE_COMPOSABLE_STOREFRONT/eaef8c61b6d9477daf75bff9ac1b7eb4/c87a11d203a74634b38ef046dbe5f734.html?locale=en-US#loioe30abb94d28d4e2886d2bb16925a095d__section_bgi_tei_spa

Or you can keep using launchDialogService and add the following code:

 
const dialog = this.launchDialogService.openDialogAndSubscribe(LAUNCH_CALLER.MY_MODAL); if (dialog) { dialog.pipe(take(1)).subscribe();

This is important because observables are lazy, so without subscribing, the dialog may not open properly or respond to closeDialog() calls.

Also, please ensure that the LAUNCH_CALLER.MY_MODAL value matches your dialog configuration, and that your dialog component is correctly registered in your storefront setup.

entry.title: Re: How to transfer a paid down payment from sales order...
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

In SAP Business ByDesign, down payments are by default linked to the originating sales order and are automatically considered during the final invoicing process. If the down payment exceeds the invoiced amount, the balance remains as a credit on the customer account. This credit cannot be transferred directly to another sales order, but it may be cleared manually against another invoice or refunded to the customer.

If you would like to reuse the down payment for a different sales order, the only option is to prevent its automatic assignment before the first invoice is created. This can be done in the Customer Invoicing work center > Invoice Documents, by selecting the down payment request and choosing “No Invoice Assignment.” Later, when the new sales order is invoiced, you can reopen the down payment request, select “Allow Invoice Assignment,” and assign it to that invoice.

This ensures the system follows the standard process while still allowing for the reapplication of the payment if needed.

For more details, please refer to the following KBAs:

2013735- Not Possible to Not Assign a Down Payment Request in an Invoice Request
URL: https://me.sap.com/notes/2013735

2809206- How To Work With Down Payments in Sales
URL: https://me.sap.com/notes/2809206

2013708 - Cannot Create Invoice When Deactivate the Down Payments Transfer Indicator
URL: https://me.sap.com/notes/2013708

 

Best regards,  
Ihan
SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Re: Actual cost rate calculation - cost centers (KSII) un...
entry.content:
Hello @mostafa_mahmoud1811_598 ,

Thank you for your feedback and great follow-up

Here’s a simple, straightforward fix for KSII shows no data in S/4HANA Cloud (Public):

Run the right period version
KSII must be executed for the correct controlling area, version 0, fiscal year/period. Help.SAP-Actual Cost Rate Calculation

Check that prerequisites exist in that period

The cost center includes activity type(s) with Actual Price Indicator set to 005.

You have posted actual primary costs and recorded actual activity quantities; otherwise, KSII has no data to price.  

Help.sap.com-Actual Cost Rate Calculation - Cost Centers

SAP Support Portal-2930774 - Actual cost rate calculation (KSII) price unit calculation logic

Maintain splitting when there are multiple activity types. Define and validate the Splitting Structure (SSCUI 104795) before running Split Costs – Actual (KSS2), then proceed with KSII. Missing or empty splitting means there are no amounts to process price. SAP Support Portal-3352159 - No entries available in Configuration Activity "Define Splitting Structure" (SSCUI 104795) 

Re-run KSII and review the log. Use the Actual Cost Rate Calculation -Cost Centers (KSII) application to check for any zero or missing lines in the log.

If nothing shows up, check the KBA for common problems, like postings with business transaction EBDP or settlement effects,  SAP Support Portal-2935116 - Actual cost rate calculation logic in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system

Hope the about explanation helps, otherwise send me the link that contains no data

Always feel free to reach out

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: MRP not considering batch length Correctly
entry.content:
Dear Community,

In a tube industry we are facing a planning issue, and I would appreciate your suggestions or possible workarounds.

Business Context

  • The tube material is managed in meters (UoM).

  • In reality, each piece has a different length (e.g., 2m, 3m, 4m, 5m).

  • In the BOM of a finished product, I need exactly 1 tube of 4m.

Problem
Currently, MRP aggregates the stock in meters.

  • Example: If I have 2 tubes of 2m each, the system considers this equal to 1 tube of 4m, and therefore does not generate a procurement proposal.

  • This results in incorrect planning, as the physical availability does not match the requirement.

Expected Behavior

  • If a 5m tube is available → it should be valid for a 4m requirement (≥ rule).

  • If only 2m tubes are available → the system should trigger a new requirement for a 4m tube.

Questions

  1. How does MRP in S/4HANA Public Cloud integrate with batch characteristics (e.g., Length)?

  2. Is it possible to define a selection rule such as Batch.Length ≥ Required Length?

  3. Or would an additional workaround/extension be necessary to cover this case?

Thank you in advance for your insights.

Best regards,

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Supply Chain 
@Caetano @Tom_Altmueller @swadhinata @Devin_Good

entry.title: Performance difference in BPC 10.1 logic script (HANA) due to temporary table locks
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We are facing a particular behavior in SAP BPC 10.1 classic on HANA.
A logic script that runs quickly in DEV takes much longer to execute in PRD.

When reviewing the job log in PRD, we noticed that during execution there are locks on tables such as:

 
LOCK TABLE "TESTDATRNRPARTB" IN EXCLUSIVE MODE
LOCK TABLE "TESTDATRNRPARTC" IN EXCLUSIVE MODE
LOCK TABLE "TESTDATRNRPARTD" IN EXCLUSIVE MODE
LOCK TABLE "TESTDATRNRPARTE" IN EXCLUSIVE MODE
TRUNCATE TABLE "TESTDATRNRPARTD"
TRUNCATE TABLE "TESTDATRNRPARTE"
TRUNCATE TABLE "TESTDATRNRPARTF"

In DEV we do not see these locks, although both environments are synchronized and have the same configuration from the BPC side.

👉Our questions to the community:

  • Does anyone know exactly what these TESTDATRNRPART* tables are and why they only appear in PRD?

  • Are there HANA or BPC configuration parameters to reduce the impact of these locks?

  • Has anyone come across an official SAP Note or recommendation on how to deal with these locks in BPC 10.1 on HANA?

  • What best practices would you recommend (e.g. job sequencing, breaking down logic, DB tuning) to avoid these locks affecting performance in production?

    Thanks in advance for your help!
